thread.title: D.J. Eliot hired as Colorado Buffaloes football’s defensive coordinator
thread.title_full: D.J. Eliot hired as Colorado Buffaloes football’s defensive coordinator

author: The Denver Post
title: D.J. Eliot hired as Colorado Buffaloes football’s defensive coordinator
text:
Editorial: Jeffco activists court disaster in Dinosaur Ridge dealership fight 
To find a new leader for its defense, Colorado turned to the SEC. 
The school officially announced Wednesday that D.J. Eliot, who spent the past four seasons as the defensive coordinator at Kentucky, has been hired to fill the same position for the Buffaloes. 
“I’m excited about having D.J. Eliot as our defensive coordinator, he brings a lot of expertise and energy to our defense,” CU coach Mike MacIntyre said in a statement. “Also he is one of the great, young defensive minds in the game of college football today.” 
Eliot, 40, has deep ties to the Front Range. He was a college linebacker at Wyoming and served as a graduate assistant for the Cowboys in 1999. His wife is from Westminster and attended Northglenn High School.
